result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J. Naumann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas J. Naumann

records.addlTxt: of DNA Collection at Conviction

3:58 PM 
Defendant Nicholas J. Naumann in court.
Attorney Mark D. Richards in court for Nicholas J. Naumann.
Attorney Brendaliz Valdes in court for State of Wisconsin.
Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance and victim present.
Defendant entered a plea of Guilty to DC-Dom. Abuse; found guilty by the court. 
Court orders a $100 fine plus costs, due in 60 days or civil judgment.  
Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
$150 cash bond on deposit to be applied to F&C.
Appeal rights given.

10:20 AM Attorney Brendaliz Valdes in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mark D. Richards in court with Nicholas J. Naumann.  Clerk: PU
  Minutes:  Atty Richards states case will be resolving with a DPA and requests a change of plea date.  Bond continues.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 03:30 pm and date approved by the Court.
